style="margin-top:2pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="margin-top:2pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">The following information is provided to aid in understanding Mastercard&#8217;s second quarter 2023 results, versus the year ago period. </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:2pt;margin-top:2pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:700;line-height:130%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%;padding-left:13.42pt">Net revenue increased 14%, or 15% on a currency-neutral basis. Excluding the impact of Second Quarter Special Items, adjusted net revenue also increased 14%, or 15% on a currency-neutral basis. The increase was attributable to our payment network and our value-added services and solutions. </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:2pt;margin-top:2pt;padding-left:54pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">&#9642;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%;padding-left:14.78pt">Payment network net revenue increased 13%, or 14% on a currency-neutral basis. Primary drivers of the increase were as follows&#58;</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:2pt;margin-top:2pt;padding-left:90pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%;padding-left:13.64pt">Gross dollar volume growth of 12%, on a local currency basis, to $2.3&#160;trillion.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:2pt;margin-top:2pt;padding-left:90pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%;padding-left:13.64pt">Cross-border volume growth of 24% on a local currency basis. </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:2pt;margin-top:2pt;padding-left:90pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%;padding-left:13.64pt">Switched transactions growth of 17%.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:2pt;margin-top:2pt;padding-left:54pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">These increases include growth in payment network rebates and incentives provided to customers. Payment network rebates and incentives increased 22% as reported and on a currency-neutral basis, primarily due to an increase in our key drivers as well as new and renewed deals. </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:2pt;margin-top:2pt;padding-left:54pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">&#9642;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%;padding-left:14.78pt">Value-added services and solutions net revenue increased 16% as reported and on a currency-neutral basis. The increase was driven primarily by the continued growth of our cyber and intelligence solutions, driven by our underlying driver growth and demand for our fraud and security solutions, and continued strong demand for consulting and marketing services, partially offset by other solutions.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:2pt;margin-top:2pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:700;line-height:130%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%;padding-left:13.42pt">Total operating expenses increased 5%. Exc</font><font style="background-color:#ffffff;color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">luding the impact of Second Quarter Special Items, adjusted operating expen</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">ses increased 12%, or 13% on a</font><font style="background-color:#ffffff;color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%"> currency-neutral basis. </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">The increase was primarily due to higher personnel costs.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:2pt;margin-top:2pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="background-color:#ffffff;color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:700;line-height:130%">&#8226;</font><font style="background-color:#ffffff;color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%;padding-left:13.42pt">Other income (expe</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">nse) was favorable $268&#160;million versus the year ago period, primarily due to net gains in the current year versus the net losses in the prior year related to unrealized fair market value adjustments on marketable securities. Adjusted other income (expense) was favorable $29&#160;million versus the prior year, primarily due to an increase in our investment income, partially offset by increased interest expense related to our 2022 and 2023 debt issuances.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:2pt;margin-top:2pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="background-color:#ffffff;color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:700;line-height:130%">&#8226;</font><font style="background-color:#ffffff;color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%;padding-left:13.42pt">The effective tax rate for the second quarter of 2023 w</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">as 23.2%, versus 18.7% for the comparable period in 2022. The adjusted effective tax rate for the second quarter of 2023 was 23.9%, versus 18.8% for</font><font style="background-color:#ffffff;color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%"> the comparable period in 2022,</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%"> primarily due to a $212 million discrete tax expense to establish a valuation allowance associated with the U.S. foreign tax credit carryforward deferred tax asset resulting from foreign tax legislation enacted in Brazil in the current period. The U.K. statutory tax rate increase, effective in 2023, also contributed to the higher as reported and as adjusted effective income tax rates for the current period.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:2pt;margin-top:2pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For cards.</font></div><div style="margin-top:12pt;text-align:justify"><font><br></font></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font><br></font></div><div MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">up 15%</font></td></tr><tr><td colspan="3" style="display:none"></td></tr></table></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:6pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">The following information is provided to aid in understanding Mastercard&#8217;s year-to-date 2023 results, versus the year ago period. As a reminder, we suspended our business operations in Russia in March 2022.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:2pt;margin-top:2pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:700;line-height:130%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%;padding-left:13.42pt">Net revenue increased 13%, or 14% on a currency-neutral basis. Excluding the impact of Year-to-date Special Items, adjusted net revenue increased 13%, or 15% on a currency-neutral basis. The increase was attributable to our payment network and our value-added services and solutions. </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:2pt;margin-top:2pt;padding-left:54pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">&#9642;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%;padding-left:14.78pt">Payment network net revenue increased 10%, or 12% on a currency-neutral basis, which would have been 1 percentage point higher if we excluded the Russia-related Year-to-date Special Items which benefited year-to-date 2022. Primary drivers of the increase were as follows&#58;</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:2pt;margin-top:2pt;padding-left:90pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%;padding-left:13.64pt">Gross dollar volume growth of 14%, on a local currency basis, to $4.4&#160;trillion.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:2pt;margin-top:2pt;padding-left:90pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%;padding-left:13.64pt">Cross-border volume growth of 29% on a local currency basis. </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:2pt;margin-top:2pt;padding-left:90pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%;padding-left:13.64pt">Switched transactions growth of 15%.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:2pt;margin-top:2pt;padding-left:54pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">These increases include growth in payment network rebates and incentives provided to customers. Payment network rebates and incentives increased 23%, or 25% on a currency-neutral basis, primarily due to an increase in our key drivers as well as new and renewed deals. </font></div><div style="height:54pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:6pt"><table style="border-collapse:collapse;display:inline-table;margin-bottom:5pt;vertical-align:text-bottom;width:100.000%"><tr><td style="width:1.0%"></td><td style="width:32.087%"></td><td style="width:0.1%"></td><td style="width:1.0%"></td><td style="width:32.087%"></td><td style="width:0.1%"></td><td style="width:1.0%"></td><td style="width:32.526%"></td><td style="width:0.1%"></td></tr><tr><td colspan="3" style="padding:0 1pt"><div><img alt="mclogoa03a.jpg" src="mclogoa03a.jpg" style="height:21px;margin-bottom:5pt;vertical-align:text-bottom;width:34px"></div></td><td colspan="3" style="padding:0 1pt"></td><td colspan="3" style="padding:2px 1pt;text-align:left;vertical-align:middle"><div style="text-align:right"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">3</font></div></td></tr></table></div></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:54pt;width:100%"><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:6pt"><font><br></font></div></div><div style="margin-bottom:2pt;margin-top:2pt;padding-left:54pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">&#9642;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%;padding-left:14.78pt">Value-added services and solutions net revenue increased 17%, or 18% on a currency-neutral basis, which includes a 1 percentage point benefit from acquisitions. The remaining increase was driven primarily by the continued growth of our cyber and intelligence solutions, driven by our underlying driver growth and demand for our fraud and security solutions, and strong demand for our consulting and marketing services, as well as our loyalty solutions.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:2pt;margin-top:2pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:700;line-height:130%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%;padding-left:13.42pt">Total operating expenses increased 11%. Excluding the impact of Year-to-date Special Items, adjusted operating expenses increased 11%, or 12% on a currency-neutral basis. This includes a 1 percentage point increase from acquisitions. The remaining increase was primarily due to higher personnel costs. </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:2pt;margin-top:2pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:700;line-height:130%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%;padding-left:13.42pt">Other income (expense) was favorable $162&#160;million, primarily due to lower net losses in the current year versus the prior year related to unrealized fair market value adjustments on marketable and non-marketable equity securities. Adjusted other income (expense) was favorable $59 million versus the year ago period, primarily due to an increase in our investment income, partially offset by increased interest expense related to our 2022 and 2023 debt issuances. </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:2pt;margin-top:2pt;padding-left:18pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-18pt"><font style="background-color:#ffffff;color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:700;line-height:130%">&#8226;</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%;padding-left:13.42pt">The effective tax rate for year-to-date 2023 was 20.6%, versus 11.9% for the comparable period in </font><font style="background-color:#ffffff;color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">2022</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">. The adjusted effective tax rate for 2023 was 21.2%, versus 12.3% for the comparable period in </font><font style="background-color:#ffffff;color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">2022</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">. The adjusted effective tax rate was higher in 2023 primarily due to a $212 million discrete tax expense to establish a valuation allowance in Q2 2023 on the remaining U.S. foreign tax credit carryforward deferred tax asset resulting from foreign tax legislation enacted in Brazil in the current period and the release of a $333 million valuation allowance in Q1 2022. The U.K. statutory tax rate increase, effective in 2023, also contributed to the higher effective income tax rate in 2023. </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:12pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Return of Capital to Shareholders</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">During the second quarter of 2023, Masterca</font><font style="background-color:#ffffff;color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">rd repurchased </font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">6.5 million </font><font style="background-color:#ffffff;color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">shares at a cost of $2.4 billion a</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">nd paid $541 million in dividends. </font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">Through the first half of 2023, Mastercard repurchased 14.4&#160;million shares at a cost of $5.3 billion and paid $1.1&#160;billion in dividends.</font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">Quarter-to-date through July&#160;24, the Company repurchased 1.3&#160;million shares at a cost of $497&#160;million, which leaves $6.4&#160;billion remaining under the approved share repurchase programs. </font></div><div style="margin-top:9pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Second Quarter 2023 Financial Results Conference Call Details</font></div><div today, the Company will host a conference call to discuss its second quarter 2023 results. A replay of the call will be available for 30 days and can be accessed by dialing 1-800-770-2030 (Toll-free) and 1-647-362-9199 (Toll dial-in), using passcode 6451878.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">A live audio webcast of this call, along with presentation slides, can also be accessed through the Investor Relations section of the Company&#8217;s website at investor.mastercard.com.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:2pt;margin-top:2pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Forward-Looking Statements </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">This press release contains forward-looking statements pursuant to the safe harbor provisions of the Private Securities Litigation Reform Act of 1995. Using secure data and networks, partnerships and passion, our innovations and solutions help individuals, financial institutions, governments and businesses realize their greatest potential. style="border-collapse:collapse;display:inline-table;margin-bottom:5pt;vertical-align:text-bottom;width:100.000%"><tr><td style="width:1.0%"></td><td style="width:32.087%"></td><td style="width:0.1%"></td></tr><tr><td colspan="3" style="padding:0 1pt"><div><img alt="mclogoa03a.jpg" src="mclogoa03a.jpg" style="height:21px;margin-bottom:5pt;vertical-align:text-bottom;width:34px"></div></td><td colspan="3" style="padding:0 1pt"></td><td colspan="3" style="padding:2px 1pt;text-align:left;vertical-align:middle"><div style="text-align:right"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">9</font></div></td></tr></table></div></div></div><div id="i31162e5fc45e4e8c8be1d45a6b6307ea_10"></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:49.5pt;width:100%"><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:6pt"><font><br></font></div></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:9pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Non-GAAP Financial Information</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">Mastercard discloses the following non-GAAP financial measures&#58; adjusted net revenue, adjusted operating expenses, adjusted operating margin, adjusted other income (expense), adjusted effective income tax rate, adjusted net income and adjusted diluted earnings per share (as well as related applicable growth rates versus the comparable period in the prior year). These non-GAAP financial measures exclude the impact of gains and losses on the Company&#8217;s equity investments which includes mark-to-market fair value adjustments, impairments and gains and losses upon disposition, as well as the related tax impacts. These non-GAAP financial measures also exclude the impact of special items, where applicable, which represent litigation judgments and settlements and certain one-time items, as well as the related tax impacts. The Company excludes these items because management evaluates the underlying operations and performance of the Company separately from these recurring and nonrecurring items.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">In addition, the Company presents growth rates adjusted for the impact of currency, which is a non-GAAP financial measure. Currency-neutral growth rates are calculated by remeasuring the prior period&#8217;s results using the current period&#8217;s exchange rates for both the translational and transactional impacts on operating results as well as removing the related impact of the Company&#8217;s foreign exchange derivative contracts designated as cash flow hedging instruments. The impact of currency translation represents the effect of translating operating results where the functional currency is different from the Company&#8217;s U.S. dollar reporting currency. The impact of the transactional currency represents the effect of converting revenue and expenses occurring in a currency other than the functional currency. The impact of the related realized gains and losses resulting from the Company&#8217;s foreign exchange derivative contracts designated as cash flow hedging instruments is recognized in the respective financial statement line item on the statement of operations when the underlying forecasted transactions impact earnings. The Company believes the presentation of currency-neutral growth rates provides relevant information to facilitate an understanding of its operating results. </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">The Company believes that the non-GAAP financial measures presented facilitate an understanding of operating performance and provide a meaningful comparison of its results between periods. The Company&#8217;s management uses non-GAAP financial measures to, among other things, evaluate its ongoing operations in relation to historical results, for internal planning and forecasting purposes and in the calculation of performance-based compensation. </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">The Company includes reconciliations of the requisite non-GAAP financial measures to the most directly comparable GAAP financial measures. The presentation of non-GAAP financial measures should not be considered in isolation or as a substitute for the Company&#8217;s related financial results prepared in accordance with GAAP.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:9pt"><font><br></font></div><div style="height:49.5pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:130%">Gains and Losses on Equity Investments</font></div><div style="padding-left:13.5pt;text-indent:-13.5pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">1.</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%;padding-left:6.4pt">Q2&#8217;23 pre-tax net gains of $123 million and Q2&#8217;22 pre-tax net losses of $117 million were primarily related to unrealized fair market value adjustments on marketable equity securities.  </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:3pt;margin-top:6pt;padding-left:13.5pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-13.5pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:130%">Second Quarter Special Items</font></div><div style="padding-left:13.5pt;text-indent:-13.5pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">2.</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%;padding-left:6.4pt">Q2&#8217;23 pre-tax charges of $20 million are as a result of settlements with a number of U.K. and Pan-European merchants.</font></div><div style="padding-left:13.5pt;text-indent:-13.5pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">3.</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%;padding-left:6.4pt">Q2&#8217;22 pre-tax charges of $133 million were as a result of a change in estimate related to the claims of merchants who opted out of the U.S. merchant class litigation.</font></div><div style="padding-left:13.5pt;text-indent:-13.5pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">4.</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%;padding-left:7.19pt">Q2&#8217;22 pre-tax net charge of $26 million was directly related to imposed sanctions and the suspension of our business operations in Russia.  The net charge is compromised of general and administrative expenses of $33&#160;million primarily related to incremental employee-related costs, offset by a net benefit of $6&#160;million in net revenue, primarily related to a reduction in payment network rebates and incentives liabilities as a result of lower estimates of customer performance for certain customer business agreements due to the suspension of our business operations in Russia. </font></div><div style="margin-top:3pt;padding-left:13.5pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-13.5pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:130%">Other Notes</font></div><div style="padding-left:13.5pt;text-indent:-13.5pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">5.</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%;padding-left:6.4pt">Represents the translational and transactional impact of currency and the related impact of the Company&#8217;s foreign exchange derivative contracts designated as cash flow hedging instruments.</font></div><div style="height:49.5pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">1.</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%;padding-left:6.4pt">Year-to-date 2023 and 2022 pre-tax net losses of $89&#160;million and $193&#160;million were primarily related to unrealized fair market value adjustments on marketable and nonmarketable equity securities. </font></div><div style="padding-left:13.5pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-13.5pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:130%">Year-to-date Special Items</font></div><div style="padding-left:13.5pt;text-indent:-13.5pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">2.</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%;padding-left:6.4pt">Year-to-date 2023 pre-tax charges of $231&#160;million are primarily as a result of a change in estimate related to the claims of merchants who opted out of the U.S. merchant class litigation.</font></div><div style="padding-left:13.5pt;text-indent:-13.5pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">3.</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%;padding-left:6.4pt">Year-to-date 2022 pre-tax charges of $133&#160;million were as a result of a change in estimate related to the claims of merchants who opted out of the U.S. merchant class litigation.</font></div><div style="padding-left:13.5pt;text-indent:-13.5pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">4.</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%;padding-left:6.4pt">Year-to-date 2022 pre-tax net charge of $30&#160;million was directly related to imposed sanctions and the suspension of our business operations in Russia. The net charge is comprised of general and administrative expenses of $67 million primarily related to incremental employee-related costs and reserves on uncollectible balances with certain sanctioned customers, offset by a net benefit of $37&#160;million in net revenue, primarily related to a reduction in payment network rebates and incentives liabilities as a result of lower estimates of customer performance for certain customer business agreements due to the suspension of our business operations in Russia. </font></div><div style="margin-top:6pt;padding-left:13.5pt;text-align:justify;text-indent:-13.5pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:700;line-height:130%">Other Notes</font></div><div style="padding-left:13.5pt;text-indent:-13.5pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">5.</font><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%;padding-left:6.4pt">Represents the translational and transactional impact of currency and the related impact of the Company&#8217;s foreign exchange derivative contracts designated as cash flow hedging instruments. </font></div><div style="height:49.5pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div 1pt;text-align:left;vertical-align:bottom"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:8pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">Note that the figures in the preceding tables may not sum due to rounding&#59; growth represents change from the comparable year ago period. </font></td></tr></table></div><div style="height:54pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:6pt"><table style="border-collapse:collapse;display:inline-table;margin-bottom:5pt;vertical-align:text-bottom;width:100.000%"><tr><td style="width:1.0%"></td><td style="width:32.087%"></td><td style="width:0.1%"></td><td style="width:1.0%"></td><td style="width:32.087%"></td><td style="width:0.1%"></td><td style="width:1.0%"></td><td style="width:32.526%"></td><td style="width:0.1%"></td></tr><tr><td colspan="3" style="padding:0 1pt"><div><img alt="mclogoa03a.jpg" src="mclogoa03a.jpg" style="height:21px;margin-bottom:5pt;vertical-align:text-bottom;width:34px"></div></td><td colspan="3" style="padding:0 1pt"></td><td colspan="3" style="padding:2px 1pt;text-align:left;vertical-align:middle"><div style="text-align:right"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">13</font></div></td></tr></table></div></div></div><div id="i31162e5fc45e4e8c8be1d45a6b6307ea_16"></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div style="min-height:54pt;width:100%"><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:6pt"><font><br></font></div></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:9pt"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:12pt;font-weight:700;line-height:120%">Footnote</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">The tables set forth the gross dollar volume (&#8220;GDV&#8221;), purchase volume, cash volume and the number of purchase transactions, cash transactions and cards on a regional and global basis for Mastercard&#8482;-branded cards. Growth rates over prior periods are provided for volume-based data.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">Debit transactions on Maestro&#174;&#160;and Cirrus&#174;-branded cards and transactions involving brands other than Mastercard are not included in the preceding tables.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">For purposes of the table&#58; GDV represents purchase volume plus cash volume and includes the impact of balance transfers and convenience checks&#59; &#8220;purchase volume&#8221; means the aggregate dollar amount of purchases made with Mastercard-branded cards for the relevant period&#59; and &#8220;cash volume&#8221; means the aggregate dollar amount of cash disbursements and includes the impact of balance transfers and convenience checks obtained with Mastercard-branded cards for the relevant period. The number of cards includes virtual cards, which are Mastercard-branded payment accounts that do not generally have physical cards associated with them.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">The Mastercard payment products are comprised of credit, charge, debit and prepaid programs, and data relating to each type of program is included in the tables. The tables include information with respect to transactions involving Mastercard-branded cards that are not switched by Mastercard and transactions for which Mastercard does not earn significant revenues.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">Information denominated in U.S. dollars is calculated by applying an established U.S. dollar&#47;local currency exchange rate for each local currency in which Mastercard volumes are reported. These exchange rates are calculated on a quarterly basis using the average exchange rate for each quarter. Mastercard reports period-over-period rates of change in purchase volume and cash volume on the basis of local currency information, in order to eliminate the impact of changes in the value of currencies against the U.S. dollar in calculating such rates of change.</font></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">The data set forth in the GDV, purchase volume, purchase transactions, cash volume and cash transactions columns is provided by Mastercard customers and is subject to verification by Mastercard and partial cross-checking against information provided by Mastercard&#8217;s transaction switching systems. The data set forth in the cards columns is provided by Mastercard customers and is subject to certain limited verification by Mastercard. A portion of the data set forth in the cards columns reflects the impact of routine portfolio changes among customers and other practices that may lead to over counting of the underlying data in certain circumstances. All data is subject to revision and amendment by Mastercard or Mastercard&#8217;s customers. Starting in the first quarter of 2022, data related to sanctioned Russian banks was not reported to us and therefore such amounts are not included. Subsequent to the suspension of our business operations in Russia in March 2022, there is no Russian data to be reported. </font></div><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:6pt;text-align:justify"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:11pt;font-weight:400;line-height:130%">Performance information for prior periods can be found in the Investor Relations section of the Mastercard website at investor.mastercard.com.</font></div><div style="height:54pt;position:relative;width:100%"><div style="bottom:0;position:absolute;width:100%"><div style="margin-bottom:6pt;margin-top:6pt"><table style="border-collapse:collapse;display:inline-table;margin-bottom:5pt;vertical-align:text-bottom;width:100.000%"><tr><td style="width:1.0%"></td><td style="width:32.087%"></td><td style="width:0.1%"></td><td style="width:1.0%"></td><td style="width:32.087%"></td><td style="width:0.1%"></td><td style="width:1.0%"></td><td style="width:32.526%"></td><td style="width:0.1%"></td></tr><tr><td colspan="3" style="padding:0 1pt"><div><img alt="mclogoa03a.jpg" src="mclogoa03a.jpg" style="height:21px;margin-bottom:5pt;vertical-align:text-bottom;width:34px"></div></td><td colspan="3" style="padding:0 1pt"></td><td colspan="3" style="padding:2px 1pt;text-align:left;vertical-align:middle"><div style="text-align:right"><font style="color:#000000;font-family:'Mark For MCNrw',sans-serif;font-size:9pt;font-weight:400;line-height:100%">14</font></div></td></tr></table></div></div></div></body></html>
</TEXT>
</DOCUMENT>

// Edgar(tm) Renderer was created by staff of the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission.  Data and content created by government employees within the scope of their employment are not subject to domestic copyright protection. 17 U.S.C. 105.
var Show={};Show.LastAR=null,Show.showAR=function(a,r,w){if(Show.LastAR)Show.hideAR();var e=a;while(e&&e.nodeName!='TABLE')e=e.nextSibling;if(!e||e.nodeName!='TABLE'){var ref=((window)?w.document:document).getElementById(r);if(ref){e=ref.cloneNode(!0);
e.removeAttribute('id');a.parentNode.appendChild(e)}}
if(e)e.style.display='block';Show.LastAR=e};Show.hideAR=function(){Show.LastAR.style.display='none'};Show.toggleNext=function(a){var e=a;while(e.nodeName!='DIV')e=e.nextSibling;if(!e.style){}else if(!e.style.display){}else{var d,p_;if(e.style.display=='none'){d='block';p='-'}else{d='none';p='+'}
e.style.display=d;if(a.textContent){a.textContent=p+a.textContent.substring(1)}else{a.innerText=p+a.innerText.substring(1)}}}
</TEXT>
</DOCUMENT>

/* Updated 2009-11-04 */
/* v2.2.0.24 */

/* DefRef Styles */

	position: absolute;
}

	display: block;

}

	margin-top: 0px;
}

}

	background-color: #2F4497;

}

}

	color: black;

}

}
